trans-unit.source: This article prepares you for the differences in backup and restore experiences when dealing with encrypted disks.

trans-unit.source: Dealing with encrypted disks during VM backup
trans-unit.target: Dealing with encrypted disks during VM backup

trans-unit.source: For enterprises looking to encrypt their VM data in Azure, the solution to use is Bitlocker on Windows or dmcrypt on Linux machines.
trans-unit.target: For enterprises looking to encrypt their VM data in Azure, the solution to use is Bitlocker on Windows or dmcrypt on Linux machines.

trans-unit.source: Both of these are volume-level encryption solutions.
trans-unit.target: Both of these are volume-level encryption solutions.

trans-unit.source: This article deals with the specifics of setting up backup for such Azure VMs, and the impact on restore workflows because of encrypted data.
trans-unit.target: This article deals with the specifics of setting up backup for such Azure VMs, and the impact on restore workflows because of encrypted data.

trans-unit.source: How backup works
trans-unit.target: How backup works

trans-unit.source: The overall solution consists of two layers - the VM layer and the Storage layer.
trans-unit.target: The overall solution consists of two layers - the VM layer and the Storage layer.

trans-unit.source: The VM layer deals with the data as seen by the guest operating system and the applications running in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The VM layer deals with the data as seen by the guest operating system and the applications running in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: It is also the layer that runs the encryption software (Bitlocker or dmcrypt), transparently encrypting data on the volumes before writing it to the disks.
trans-unit.target: It is also the layer that runs the encryption software (Bitlocker or dmcrypt), transparently encrypting data on the volumes before writing it to the disks.

trans-unit.source: The Storage layer deals with the page blobs and the disks attached to the VM.
trans-unit.target: The Storage layer deals with the page blobs and the disks attached to the VM.

trans-unit.source: It has no knowledge of the data being written to the disk, and whether it is encrypted or not.
trans-unit.target: It has no knowledge of the data being written to the disk, and whether it is encrypted or not.

trans-unit.source: This is the layer at which the VM backup functionality operates.
trans-unit.target: This is the layer at which the VM backup functionality operates.

trans-unit.source: How Bitlocker encryption and Azure VM backup coexist
trans-unit.target: How Bitlocker encryption and Azure VM backup coexist

trans-unit.source: The entire encryption of data happens transparently and seamlessly in the VM layer.
trans-unit.target: The entire encryption of data happens transparently and seamlessly in the VM layer.

trans-unit.source: Thus the data written to the page blobs attached to the VM is encrypted data.
trans-unit.target: Thus the data written to the page blobs attached to the VM is encrypted data.

trans-unit.source: When [Azure Backup takes a snapshot of the VM’s disks and transfers data](backup-azure-vms-introduction.md#how-does-azure-back-up-virtual-machines), it copies the encrypted data present on the page blobs.
trans-unit.target: When [Azure Backup takes a snapshot of the VM’s disks and transfers data](backup-azure-vms-introduction.md#how-does-azure-back-up-virtual-machines), it copies the encrypted data present on the page blobs.
